## Ice Cream Blog




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.6
✔ forcats   1.0.1     ✔ stringr   1.6.0
✔ ggplot2   4.0.1     ✔ tibble    3.3.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.2
✔ purrr     1.2.1     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ice_cream <- read_csv("https://bcdanl.github.io/data/ben-and-jerry-cleaned.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 21974 Columns: 17
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): flavor_descr, size1_descr, region, race
dbl (5): priceper1, household_id, household_income, household_size, couponper1
lgl (8): usecoup, married, hispanic_origin, microwave, dishwasher, sfh, inte...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
head(ice_cream)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

```


:::
:::



## Flavor Price Descriptions



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ice_cream|>
  arrange(
    desc(priceper1)
  )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 21,974 × 17
   priceper1 flavor_descr              size1_descr household_id household_income
       <dbl> <chr>                     <chr>              <dbl>            <dbl>
 1      9.48 CHERRY GRCA               32.0 MLOZ       30241250           170000
 2      8.98 MINT CHC CHUNK            16.0 MLOZ       30188192           130000
 3      8.98 HEATH CRUNCH              16.0 MLOZ        8023944           130000
 4      8.98 CHERRY GRCA               16.0 MLOZ        8023944           130000
 5      8.5  PHISH FOOD                16.0 MLOZ       30380086            70000
 6      8    NEW YORK SUPER FUDGE CHU… 16.0 MLOZ        2111310           110000
 7      7.99 CHC CHIP C-DH             32.0 MLOZ        9086010           150000
 8      7.98 PB CUP                    16.0 MLOZ       30122895            60000
 9      7.98 NEW YORK SUPER FUDGE CHU… 16.0 MLOZ       30122895            60000
10      7.98 NEW YORK SUPER FUDGE CHU… 16.0 MLOZ       30289450            80000
# ℹ 21,964 more rows
# ℹ 12 more variables: household_size <dbl>, usecoup <lgl>, couponper1 <dbl>,
#   region <chr>, married <lgl>, race <chr>, hispanic_origin <lgl>,
#   microwave <lgl>, dishwasher <lgl>, sfh <lgl>, internet <lgl>, tvcable <lgl>
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = ice_cream,
       mapping = aes(
         y = flavor_descr
       ))+
  geom_bar()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Ice_Cream_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



The range of popularity for the flavors is very wide.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pop_flavors<- ice_cream|>
  count(flavor_descr, name = "n")|>
  filter(
    n>400
  )|>
  arrange(
    desc(n)
  )|>
  head(10)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = pop_flavors,
       mapping = aes(
       x = n,
       y = flavor_descr))+
  geom_col()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Ice_Cream_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



The ten most popular flavors are listed above. Among them, Cherry Garcia is the most popular flavor.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
price_by_flav <- ice_cream|>
  filter(
    size1_descr == "16.0 MLOZ"
  )|>
  group_by(flavor_descr)|>
  summarise( n = n(),
             mean_price = mean(priceper1)
  )
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = price_by_flav,
       mapping = aes(
         x = n,
         y = mean_price
       ))+
  geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Ice_Cream_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::




There is no clear relationship between popular flavors and their average prices




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tot_prices <- ice_cream|>
  mutate(
    price_paid = priceper1 - couponper1
  )|>
  group_by(
    household_income, region
  )|>
  summarize(
    mean_price_paid = mean(price_paid), .groups = "drop"
  )
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = tot_prices,
       mapping = aes(
        x = household_income,
        y = mean_price_paid,
        fill = household_income
       ))+
  geom_col()+
    facet_wrap(~region)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Ice_Cream_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

The price paid for Ben and Jerry's ice cream is similar among households. There are minimal differences among regions in the United States.
